intro: Drimys winteri var. winteri, commonly known as the Chilean winter's bark, is a deciduous shrub native to the temperate rainforests of southern Chile. It belongs to the family Winteraceae, a group of primitive flowering plants with ancient evolutionary origins. The plant is characterized by its glossy, lance-shaped leaves and small, fragrant white flowers that appear in clusters. Its bark is thick and corky, often used in traditional medicine by indigenous communities. The species thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the cool, humid climate of its native habitat.
